description: I like it. It is good pomodoro timer.
Integrates well with Gnome 3. Nice little productivity tool.
Does its job really well, nicely customisable. A nice extra feature would be adding a possibility to lengthen pomodoro with 5 minutes if you're in the middle of something and the time runs out.
I personally love this application and use it daily for my work. It has all the needed features you would want. Integrates well with GNOME3.
I like this application. Beautiful UI and great feature. Thanks for for developing this app.
summary: Very useful customizable and great extension

description: It would be great if this thing could tie in site list blocking (facebook, etc) to the focusing stints.

This app is quite simple. But it has everything that it should. I can make my own pomodoro time (45 mins work 10 min break). Make longer break longer after 4 pomodoro etc.

Another great thing about this app is that you cannot ignore alerts, because they dim your screen and inform that break just started, or you should start working.

This is the perfect little Pomodoro application for me and I assume most anyone who would need one. Quickly replaced other applications that I have been using for years. Integration with Gnome is fantastic!
summary: Instantly loved it, convenient and beautiful

description: Closed all my windows and workspaces when my break happened
Like that it follows the UNIX philosophy of doing one thing well and not including the kitchen sink. Fits well within GNOME too.
I very like this app and use it a lot.
summary: Very productive and has a nice GUI

description: Simple and useful. It fits Gnome very well.
Does what it says it does.
summary: Works very well, thank you for making this app

description: Very usefull tool.
Makes Gnome enter a crashloop, cant login with it running and the desktop have locked itself, have to reboot.
It is really great integration.

Love it. Easy to use, good overview over settings and nice to be able to just lengthen breaks or focustime. Kudos to the developer!
Only thing that bugs me is that the pomodoro notifications don't show up on my phone through KDE Connect. Just a small thing, but doesn't have to do with the app itself.
It does the job and it's very discrete, default configuration are good enough for me.
summary: Great app, very lightweight but effective, it does it's job

description: works out of the box, nice UI, everything I need

Just the timer. You track the activities themselves elsewhere (I use zim, a sheet of paper works just as well).

Integrates nicely with gnome shell. Notifications and pomodoro/break durations configurable.

Comes with a plugin for shell command execution if you need fancy stuff happening upon timer events.
summary: Does one thing, does it well

I've tried using it several times, but the app can't even complete a single 25 minute cycle without crashing!

It has an icon that shows the time left in the taskbar, auto dims your screen during a break with the time left displayed, and automatically restarts your next pomodoro timer when you interact with your computer after the timer.

Very nice for a simple little app.

1) When you configure click sound volume (e.g. setting it low), the setting works only till and of a period, then it becomes LOUD again. 
2) Today data and current week data displaying incorrect, but displaying current month is okay.
3) need activity types selection
summary: Has some issues but still usable

Está perfectamente integrada con el escritorio gnome. Muy útil el plugin que te permite automatizar la ejecución de comandos con disparadores en los estados del pomodoro. Por ejemplo yo uso esta función para apagar la lámpara del monitor cuando se inicia un pomodoro y para volverla a encender al finalizarlo. Lo que creo que mejoraría la aplicación sería poder definir perfiles para distintas actividades, sería genial.

L'intégration dans la barre gnome est très bien.

Fais ce que l'on attend d'une telle application, ni plus ni moins, ce qui est je trouve un point positif. S'intègre très bien à Gnome Shell (indicateur, notifications, détection d'activité pour la reprise du minuteur, overlay...).

Très bien pensé : affichage du temps écoulé (jauge) dans la barre du haut dans Gnome, écran noir quand il faut faire la pause, etc. J'ai testé plusieurs logiciels de ce type et c'est celui que j'ai gardé.
